page.title: 02LITTLE BADDOW COMMUNITY
page.content: The village community is comprised of several elements, farmers and their families who have worked on the land in the area for many generations, the newer residents, many of whom commute to Chelmsford, Romford, and London, and those who have been born and bred in the village. The main focal points of the village are the Post Office/ general store, the butchers, two public houses and a Memorial Hall which acts as a meeting place for local societies. The Chelmer/ Blackwater Navigation canal runs west to east 1km north of the village and is a navigable section of the River Chelmer providing the opportunity for transportation and tourism. Little Baddow is a typical farming community which is changing due to the increasing influence of local towns.
